utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can't just-- You can't! Just-- At least tell me how serious it is!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What's with the stripped cab?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Security guard wondered the same thing. That's when he came across the body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who's our victim?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Amir Alhabi, taxi driver.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, contact auto theft. Have them on the lookout for these stolen car parts.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Already done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was there money on the body?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not on the body, not in the cab. Everything points to him being popped for cash and car parts.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not everything, baby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you just call him baby?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Ooh. Did I?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyway, you found something unusual?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not at first. Time of death fits a robbery. He was killed at 11:15.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So specific. I'm impressed.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: His watch broke when he fell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, you shouldn't've told me. Less impressed.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Cause of death fits, too. Looks like a 9mm to the noggin. But there's something that doesn't fit. His fingers were broken one at a time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cabbies sometimes hide their money. Maybe they tortured him to tell them where the money was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let's find out where he was driving and who he picked up before he wound up here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Amir Alhabi, a real immigrant success story. Came over from Syria seven years ago, became a citizen last June. According to the taxi and limo commission, he owned his cab and medallion with a cousin, Jamal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, right. Well, TLC would know where Amir was, right? They track cabs?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only when the meter is running. Amir shut his off at 10:02 p.m.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, there's no way to tell where he went before he died.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, there is. Amir subscribed to a GPS tracking service. It helps cabbies map out the best place to troll for fares, stuff like that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Anyway, after Amir shut off his meter, he drove up to Washington Heights. He parked in the 1600 block of St. Nicholas Avenue for six minutes, motor running, and then he drove to the warehouse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Washington Heights is a shady place that time of night and if he turned off his meter, he wasn't looking for a fare.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he was carjacked and forced to drive to that warehouse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, have unis canvass the area. See if anyone remembers seeing him. What about his last phone call?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: 10:01 to his wife, Nazihah Alhabi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Let's go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, there was one more thing on the phone. Amir opened a notebook application and he, uh, wrote down this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, C4121652. And it was written down just about an hour before he died.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And it's not a license tag.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, see if you can figure it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got it. Seven digits. It's a phone number. C is the initial of the person to whom it belongs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I already tried that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With all the New York area codes?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Intriguing. Maybe--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Coming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Alhabi, we understand that Amir called you at ten. What did the two of you talk about?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Just that he'd be late. The plays were getting out on Broadway and he wanted to pick up more fares.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, he didn't do that. He turned his meter off and he went up to Washington Heights. That part of town is known for drug dealing and prostitution.

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: No. He would never do such things.

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Jamal, thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, there was annotation on Amir's phone. Do you have any idea what this is?

utterance.speaker: JAMAL ALHABI
utterance.content: C4121652. No, I--I thought that this was a robbery, that he was robbed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was. It's just, any minor detail might be relevant. How did he seem lately?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Worried about money. Mollica, our daughter, she needed surgery. It's been very hard. She'll never know her father. Please excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jamal, you and Amir were business partners?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How was the business doing?

utterance.speaker: JAMAL ALHABI
utterance.content: You don't get rich driving a cab, but we made money. Amir drove and we rented shifts to other drivers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who were they?

utterance.speaker: JAMAL ALHABI
utterance.content: Uh, Kevin McCann and, uh, Dmitri Voldov.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, you didn't drive the cab?

utterance.speaker: JAMAL ALHABI
utterance.content: For me the taxi medallion was an investment. I just started a new business, a moving company.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: TLC doesn't issue a lot of medallions. Would've been worth a small fortune. So, who inherits Amir's share?

utterance.speaker: JAMAL ALHABI
utterance.content: Nazihah will. She'll need it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Auto Theft got a hit on the stolen car parts. Guy named Leman Jones was selling them at a chop shop. VIN number on the parts matches our cab.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where's Jones now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Interrogation.

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: I found those car parts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: On the car that you stripped. We have a witness who places you at the scene. So, please, just stop with the lying.

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: A witness? Okay, I stripped that taxi. It's what I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: After you killed the driver.

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: After I what? No. I didn't kill any driver, 'cause there was no driver.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was left in the warehouse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Robbed and shot in the head.

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: Well, not by me. Okay? I was cruising and I saw the cab sitting empty, and I figure, no sense in letting good parts go to waste.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time was that?

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: I don't know. About 11:15 probably.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there you go, that's right when he died.

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: Look, no, I don't hurt people! I'm just a car guy! Your witness must've done it. That's it. And I was just playing innocent bystander or something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There was no witness.

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was bluffing.

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: Bluffing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, she's allowed to do that. I'm surprised you don't know that.

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: No! I mean, there was a guy there! I saw him!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What guy? Describe him.

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: I didn't get a clear look. He ran off when I pulled up. But he was there. He was there looking for something in the car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What makes you say that?

utterance.speaker: LEMAN JONES
utterance.content: Because he did a number on the interior. He tore up the upholstery.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Think he's telling the truth?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That guy does not have the improv skills to make up a lie like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have CSU check the car for signs that someone else tampered with it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I... Sorry, you guys. I gotta get this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not now, Ryan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's going on with her?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know Beckett. She plays it close to the vest.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, I, uh, spoke to one of the drivers who rents a shift with Amir's cab.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kevin McCann?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, no. The other one. Dmitri Voldov. He alibied out, but he had lots to say about McCann. Him and Amir got in a major fight two days ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, Dmitri didn't know, but Amir told him he was gonna fire McCann.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And where's McCann now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Renting a shift at Allied Taxi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, I'll-- I'll tell Beckett then.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Could you? That'd be best.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN MCCANN
utterance.content: Amir and I had words. No law against that, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night at 11:15?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN MCCANN
utterance.content: In this cab driving a drunk bond trader to the Upper West, why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, because that's when he was murdered.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN MCCANN
utterance.content: You're kidding me. Look, I didn't lay a hand on that guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why did you and he fight two days ago?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN MCCANN
utterance.content: Because he was raping me on rent. Look, the guy could afford it, he was flashing a roll that could choke a horse. Five grand easy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, was he known for carrying around that much money?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN MCCANN
utterance.content: First I saw of it. Look, um, are we done here? Because my meter's running.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Amir was struggling to pay medical bills, what was he doing with that much cash?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's Esposito. He needs us back at the crime scene ASAP.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Remember Leman Jones said that some other dude messed with the cab?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, CSU just figured out why.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The car had cameras.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Pinhole cameras. Microphones, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great. All we have to do is rewind to last night, see who was after him, case closed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We can't. They ripped out the hard drives with all the video data.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell's going on here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Strange thing is, Amir's wife, his cousin, other drivers, none of them knew that he'd installed those cameras.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Maybe Amir was doing a reality show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See, I thought that, too. But turns out no. And they weren't installed by law enforcement either.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You think someone was spying on him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or his passengers. Or both. Maybe it's like in The Conversation and he overheard a murder plot. Whatever it is, it's juicy.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Have you, uh-- have you talked to your father about our little trip?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, what are you waiting for? I have scored two incredibly hard to get spots at the Oasis of Serenity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's fantastic. What is that?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You haven't heard of the Serenity?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It's a spiritual retreat.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, it's nestled in the Catskills. It's a sanctuary, a place for reflection, getting in touch with your inner self.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, in-- in your case, is that wise?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gram wants to shed her ego in preparation for teaching her acting classes.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes. And who better to do that with than Alexis? We will stay in luxury yurts. We will have meditation classes, yoga classes. We go tomorrow night. That is, if you will allow her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I suppose...

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Physics.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fizzy...physic--

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Physics.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Physics. Physics exam! Don't you have a physics exam?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: My-- my physics exam. I almost forgot. It's on Monday morning, I haven't studied, and it counts for 20% of my grade.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Twenty percent.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Carpe diem. Seize the day. Clearly, I didn't teach that to my son. All right, darling, well, another time. I guess I will just have to find my inner self by myself. Hm. I can do it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Best dad ever.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ...if you were here, that would be great.

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: That helps.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn't .

utterance.speaker: JOSH
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. What brings Motorcycle Boy here? Dr. Motorcycle Boy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does he need a reason?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It just looked personal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was. Where are we on those hidden cameras?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Just that they were installed by a pro. Techs are running the serial numbers now to find out where they came from. A guy with surveillance in his cabs, too much money in his pocket, the whole thing feels hinky.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Based on his financials, it looks hinky, too. Guy had medical bills up the wazoo, but then there's this from five days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A cash deposit for ten thousand dollars?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's a struggling cab driver doing with that kind of cash?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I just found something weird. I logged into Amir's GPS account to track where he drove the day he died. At 4:07 p.m., Amir picked up a cash fare at 15th and Avenue of the Americas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's weird about that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the passenger rode for 26 minutes, then got dropped off at the same corner where Amir picked him up. Now, who would pay thirty bucks to go in a circle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone who wanted to talk to Amir.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Check those traffic cameras, see if we can get a look at that passenger.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On it, Captain.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We got a match on those cameras hidden in Amir's cab. Cameras were ordered a week ago by a Techno Pro Systems.

utterance.speaker: CRAIG
utterance.content: I don't know what you guys are talking about. I didn't install any hidden cameras.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your name's on the purchase order.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As is your signature.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You violated the expectation of privacy act. Do you know that I could arrest you for that?

utterance.speaker: CRAIG
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean-- I mean, no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or you could just tell her who hired you to install the surveillance equipment.

utterance.speaker: CRAIG
utterance.content: I promised him I'd keep it on the DL.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who hired you?

utterance.speaker: CRAIG
utterance.content: Amir Alhabi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You put it in for Amir?

utterance.speaker: CRAIG
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would he have you put cameras in his cab?

utterance.speaker: CRAIG
utterance.content: Security reasons. That's all he said.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Cap! Caught a break on our mystery passenger off a traffic cam where Amir dropped the guy off. Notice anything?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: He's carrying.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. He's not police. Suit's way too fancy.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Canvass where this was taken. See if anyone knows who he is.

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: I keep track of the expenses for the cab. There was never any bill for cameras.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the $10,000?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: The first time I heard about the money is today. I can't imagine where it came from.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Money, cameras, Washington Heights. Nazihah, your husband was clearly hiding something from you. Do you have any idea what it was?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: No. No, I don't understand this at all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, do you recognize this man? He rode in your husband's cab.

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Yes. Y--yes. He was here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Last week. He and Amir were talking in the street.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was he?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: I asked Amir. He said that the man had mistaken him for someone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Amir clearly knew the guy. Why would he lie to her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How does he end up dead the same day this guy rides in his cab?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We just got a hit on our canvass for the mystery passenger.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We got a name on that face?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet, but he's a big fan of this coffee shop on 14th. He shows up every afternoon for an espresso at two.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir! In the cream suit! Stop! NYPD, turn around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's a 9mm, just like our murder weapon. Do you have a concealed weapons permit?

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: Inside left pocket of my jacket, along with my credentials.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fariq Yusef, Syrian Consulate.

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: At your service.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Put your hands down.

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Two days ago, you were driving in a cab with Amir Alhabi. He's been murdered.

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: I am saddened to hear that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were in that cab for half an hour. What's the nature of your relationship?

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: I have diplomatic immunity, you have no stand...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who killed him? Was it you?

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: in questioning...or detaining me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Answer my question, did you kill him?

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: I'd like my pistol, please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can collect it at the 12th Precinct.

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: And so I shall.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Fariq Yusef 's official title at the consulate is the Head of Security. He's a member of the Secret Police.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he's probably broken a few fingers in his day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Yusef also owned a 9mm gun, which was the same kind of gun that killed Amir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Yusef recruited him here, drew him into the shadowy world of espionage. Once he finished his mission, his fate was sealed. Yusef killed him to tie up loose ends, and then took the data drive containing the explosive revelations.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that would be what, exactly?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm-- still thinking on that. But it's a perfect fit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, except that Fariq Yusef isn't the killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure? Because that would ruin a perfectly good theory.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. The night Amir was killed, Fariq was with the Syrian ambassador at a soccer game at Bennett Field. There are photos online to prove it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which brings us back to square one. Okay. So, Amir and Yusef take a tour of Lower Manhattan. And then later on that same night, he calls his wife, tells her that he's still working, and instead went up to Washington Heights.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And he ends up dead at the warehouse with the data drive ripped out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C4121652. Amir took his cab down St. Nicholas Ave. to the 1600 block. He parked mid-block.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So-- So, I'm just thinking the 1652 part of C4121652 is an address. What's at St. Nicholas Ave. at 1652?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: North Manhattan Storage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C412 is a storage unit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Murder, political intrigue, cash payments, and now a mysterious storage locker? Oh, this is too good. Wait, how're we gonna get it open?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, if all else fails...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For reasons-- too disturbing to mention, I-- I find that hot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or. I grabbed Amir's keys from property. So, hopefully, this is his locker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which it is. What do you think's in there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't know. Might be empty like Al Capone's vault.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. Think of all the amazing things that are found in storage units at times like this. "Ark of the Covenant, Dr. Jones."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the Ark of the Covenant was in a crate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Plastic explosives.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, get out! Get out!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why? Look, I don't--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, back away from the door! Get away!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's going on? What is that thing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is Detective Kate Beckett, badge number 0334! I've been exposed to high levels of radiation. We need emergency services right away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, you can't just-- You can't! Just, at least tell me how serious it is!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How badly did they get hit?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We don't know. But the best way for us to help them is to keep working on this case. Now, our murder victim had a key to this storage unit. So, he was into a lot more than driving a taxi. Dig deep into Amir Alhabi. Let's get his wife and his cousin in here. Meanwhile, I'll call the Syrian consulate and find out why Amir had contact with the head of security.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: They won't talk to you. Whatever Alhabi was into, the Syrians don't want blowing back on them.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Excuse me, who are you?

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: You must be Captain Montgomery. I'm Mark Fallon, Department of Homeland Security. EHS sent me down here to act as a liaison. I understand you have a situation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Those hazmat teams are only staying in the building for about a minute at a time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe it's just standard protocol.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Or maybe it's just too hot in there to handle. That radiation detector of yours. Does it have a scale on it? You know, like chest x-ray to Chernobyl?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maxed out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: We have to assume Alhabi wasn't acting alone. Where are we on his wife and cousin?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: She's on her way in. According to her neighbor, Jamal went out drinking. We're trying to track him down.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Amir either had the nuclear material for himself, or he was holding onto it for someone. Either way, odds are that's what got him killed. Check his phone records against the terror watch list.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We're already doing that. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Just so I'm clear, are you taking over?

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: This is your case. I'm just here to lend support however I can.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Cap. IC just sent all the immigration papers for Amir Alhabi. He got a degree in electrical engineering from a school in Damascus.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: What was he working on in Syria?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I got that one. I just spoke with the State Department. They debriefed Amir when he first landed here. They say he was working on a weapons program for the Syrians.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Nuclear weapons?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Okay. Now I'm taking over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's a bomb. It's a nuclear bomb in that locker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we don't know that it's a bomb.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we will as soon as it goes off, in that nanosecond before we're vaporized. I'm sorry. It's just the-- the writer in me going to worst case scenario.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we just talk about something else?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. How's Josh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. He's, um...he's on his way to Haiti to do another Doctors Without Borders mission.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's so funny, Castle. You know, at first I loved that he was so busy. It just...just gave me an opportunity to keep one foot out the door just in case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But with one foot out the door, it's hard to know where you stand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And even if I did, I mean, what does it mean? He's out there. He's saving people. Just-- how do you even compete with that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can't. No. No one can.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that's one of the things that attracted me to him the most. That...passion. That...drive. Why is it that the thing that attracts you to a person always ends up being that thing that just drives you crazy? I just wish that it-- I wish that I had someone who would be there for me, and I could be there for him, and we could just dive in to it together.

utterance.speaker: HAZMAT SPECIALIST
utterance.content: You're free to go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, we are?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the radiation?

utterance.speaker: HAZMAT SPECIALIST
utterance.content: We found residual traces of Cobalt 60 in the storage unit. Not enough to cause any health problems.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, Castle, we're all real glad you two are okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks, sir. So are we. I'm confused, though. Is this just a false alarm?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Well, not exactly. If you're up to it, we really could use you back at the precinct. I can fill you in on the way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Those traces of Cobalt 60, where did they come from?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We think there was a second crate at the storage unit which contained large quantities of Cobalt 60. We found wire and crimp on connectors, which leads us to believe the crate was outfitted with explosives.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A bomb?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: A dirty bomb.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is it now?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: That's what we're trying to find out.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, Dad. Late night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, still going. I just came back to change my clothes.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, bid my ego adieu. I am off to the Oasis. Minus Alexis, thanks to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I changed my mind about that.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You have?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You have?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I think it's important you have time together.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, my faith in you is restored.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, what about my physics test? I can't just leave.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, sure you can. Just take them with you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I haven't packed or anything. I--

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, honey, everything is provided there. Oh, we're going to have so much fun! Come on, let's get a bag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go. It'll-- it'll be good for you.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Due to the nature of this case, let me remind you not to discuss it with anyone. Not even family. We can't afford to have word leak out and cause a panic. Let me turn this over to Agent Fallon.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Thank you, Captain. All right, folks, here's what we know. Amir Alhabi built a bomb in storage unit C412. It's a dirty bomb, designed to explode and disperse a highly radioactive Cobalt 60. That bomb is missing...

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Called Jenny to tell her I'd be late. Tried to get her to go visit her mom.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I did the same thing with Lanie. Didn't work. She hates her mom.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mm.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: ...Interview facility employees. Check surveillance video. You know the drill. We find the person who moved the bomb, we'll find where it is. Let's get on it.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, I'd like to thank you for your fine work on this case. However, I can't have civilians on the front lines.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's as though I'm getting a raise and getting fired at the same time.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Except for, you don't actually work here. It's for your own protection.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, my friend the governor will be very disappointed to hear it.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Okay. Just try and stay out of the way. Detective Beckett, a word.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He doesn't trust me.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Or anyone else. Nature of the job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, how can I help?

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Amir's wife, how did she seem during the interview?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like a woman who had just lost her husband.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Did she appear truthful?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. At the time she did.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: I'm gonna want you in there with me, okay? I think it's important she sees a friendly face. If I go over the line, you just reel me back in. That's a nice touch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: The baby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nazihah, this is Agent Fallon.

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Do you have news about Amir's case?

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, I do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That $10,000 was wired into Amir's account.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which means it can be traced. Pull up the track fund database and put in the routing and account numbers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa. Just downloaded footage of unit C412 for the last 48. Hopefully that's when somebody stopped by.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An Arab terrorist, who'd believe it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Think back, bro.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's my point, it's been done.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which means it's tried and true.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not this time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe it's not what we think. That 10,000 that was wired in, it's from a bank in Dearborn, Michigan from a James Smith.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The most common name in America. It's probably bogus.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Plus, there's a major Middle Eastern population in Dearborn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Four minutes before it was transferred out, it was transferred in from James Smith, Texas Southern Bank.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoever sent that ten grand covered his tracks by daisy-chaining the money through different banks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Didn't cover them that well if I can follow them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I'll bet Amir's wife could shed some light. And I hope that Fallon's going all Jack Bauer on her ass.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe she didn't know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They were together, bro. Could you be a terrorist without Jenny knowing?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Amir was not a terrorist. He loved this country.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet he was in possession of--

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Where's the bomb, Mrs. Alhabi?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: I told you, I know nothing about a bomb. Amir would never do such a thing. Why would he?

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: He needed the cash. That baby of yours is a money pit. The bills started piling up; he got in bed with the wrong people. I need you to tell me who they were.

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: I swear to you, I don't know.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: How can you not know the man you're sharing a bed with is a terrorist? You're a part of it!

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: I have nothing to hide.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: But you do. And I'm gonna find it. And when I do, I'm gonna lock you up as a material witness and send that baby off to foster care.

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: No, you can't do that.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Oh, yes, I can. Watch me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, can I talk to you?

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: No. Go ahead, kiss your daughter goodbye.

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Please!

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Social Services is right outside that door.

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Please! Please, why are you doing this?

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Nazihah. Nazihah, that means honesty, right?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Why are you doing this?

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Honesty, is that what it means in Arabic?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: Please, I swear to you, I don't know!

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: I'm gonna give you one more chance to be honest with me, or I will take your baby away and you will never see it again!

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: I swear!

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Do you understand?

utterance.speaker: NAZIHAH ALHABI
utterance.content: I swear to you, I don't know! I don't know anything! Please don't take her away from me; she's the only thing I have! Please! Please.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: All right. Nobody's going to take your baby away from you.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Here. It's okay. You appreciate the tight spot I'm in, I'm sure. I have to be sure you're telling the truth. Agent Garda will drive you home. You're free to go.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: You still think she's truthful? I just want your opinion. Truthful or no?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. But I still have to operate under the assumption that she's lying.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: While she was in here, I pulled a national security certificate. Her house has just been bugged. She'll be under surveillance 24/7. If she's hiding something, we'll find it. It's important that she believes I think she's telling the truth. You did good. She considers you an ally. That could be helpful later. Thanks for playing, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That money that Amir received is wired through six banks, but originated in...Afghanistan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh. Got a visitor at C412 six hours before you and Beckett got there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is the break we've been looking for.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That crate looks heavy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's all the lead shielding. That's Amir's cousin, Jamal. And he has the bomb.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Jamal Alhabi. He had his cousin, Amir, fashion a dirty bomb, and then he killed him. He's most likely the leader of our terrorist cell. Less than twelve hours ago, he disappeared. Along with the bomb. Now, at minimum, he'd need a van or an SUV to transport it. Jamal owns a moving company. So, check his trucks. Pull traffic video. Work his financials. Folks, we live here. Our families, our loved ones, our neighbors. I don't have to tell you what's at stake. Let's find him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I talk to you a second?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's your take on Fallon?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Smart cop, driven, killer instinct. As a person? Kind of a douche.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Open-minded douche?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The key to any good story is authenticity. It's making it feel real for the reader. That's why writers work so hard making the details right. Jamal and Amir as terrorists? The details are not right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but the evidence is. Castle, we've got Jamal on video wheeling off a dirty bomb.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why wasn't he nervous? Why wasn't he sweating bullets every time he hit a bump? Jamal owned a moving company. What if he didn't know what was in the crate? What if he was just hired to pick it up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What if he's just a cold blooded killer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, nothing we've learned points to that with either of these men.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, what about that money that Amir received? The money that you traced back to Afghanistan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To a bank outside Bagram Air Base, often used by military personnel. Why would a terrorist pick that bank to wire money?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, the keys that we used to open that storage unit are from Amir's keychain.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The killer could've put the key there. All these breadcrumbs that have led us to Amir and Jamal, what if they were left there for us to find?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something else is going on here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. What would you like us to do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Talk to the one person who has a different view of Amir. But I'm gonna need your help.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: All right, listen up! Jamal bought these trucks over two months ago. It's a perfect cover for moving material without anyone noticing. Where's the list of his employees?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just came in. Nine guys, all Middle Eastern.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: All right. They're all probably part of the cell. Let's get their 20s and then move on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Got a purchase on Jamal's credit card three weeks ago for a burner phone.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Run it down and see if we can pull up any recent activity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jamal's moving trucks are parked in a lot in Queens. They're all accounted for except for one five ton and the log says Jamal checked it out twelve hours ago, never brought it back.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: He must've used it to move the crate. Call in that alert. Let's find the truck.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Where's Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't know. Must've stepped out.

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: Off the record or not, why should I talk to you about Amir Alhabi?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because the last thing you want is my country thinking your country's behind his activities.

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: Nothing is further from the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, then maybe you can help clear this up. Amir was in your nuclear program, so he was an asset. You have him watched?

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: It's my business to stay informed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You ever see any evidence of terrorism?

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: No. But then, what other answer could I give you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why were you at Amir's home?

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: To chat with him. I am adept at violence, but it wasn't called for. I met with Amir from time to time to remind him of his history.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To convince him to come back. Back to the weapons program.

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: Amir did vital research for us, but he left because he had moral qualms about his work. Normally money can overcome such obstacles. Not so with Amir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened on that cab ride?

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: Amir sought me out. He was quite angry. He believed I'd placed $10,000 in his account as a way of pressuring him. But he was mistaken.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. You're saying Amir didn't know where the money came from?

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: It's nice speaking to you, Mr. Castle. As events unfold, you may find yourself in need of a man with my skills.

utterance.speaker: FARIQ YUSEF
utterance.content: If such a moment arises.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you realize what this means?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Amir didn't know about the money, then he couldn't even pay to build that bomb.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Can I speak with the two of you, please?

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Now, I like to cover my bases. So, you can imagine my surprise when I find out one of our own is having a nonfat latte with a suspect in this investigation. I have agents on Fariq Yusef.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you just allow me to explain--

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: I don't even know what you're doing here. And you go and talk to a foreign official. What if the Syrians are behind this? Do you have any idea what you've done?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jamal and Amir are not terrorists. You're chasing the wrong guys.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Do you have any idea how many laws you've broken? I ought to have you arrested.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I think what Castle is trying--

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, did you know about this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, I did.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Well, that's disappointing. In the interest of national security, I'm gonna have to have the both of you removed from this task force. Do you understand?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Sir. Beckett's the best I have. Now, Castle can be a pain in the ass, but he thinks outside the box.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: It's not your party anymore, Captain. I'll have my agents escort you out. Oh, and Castle. The governor...he's never heard of you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are Alexis and Martha?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I sent them out of town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do they know why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. You get a hold of Josh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Couldn't get through to his cell. He's probably already on the plane.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A 600 thread count shower curtain murder board. I snapped a photo of it as we were being thrown out. And here...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have Amir's driving data. It's like our own mini-precinct.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except it smells better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, even if Amir is innocent, Jamal isn't.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His guilt is predicated on Amir being a terrorist. Without that, Jamal's just another guy moving a crate. Now, this all comes back to Amir. What we need to do is solve his murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is a photo off the moving company's website. This is the exact truck we're looking for.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: All right, send it downtown. Get it circulated to every officer on duty.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sir, you better have a look at this.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: What do you got?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Tech just got me locked into Jamal's burner phone. Looks like he just sent a text to another burner.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: How many choppers you have in your fleet?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Seven.

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: All right. This truck could be parked with the bomb set to go off just like Oklahoma City. Coordinate a street by street grid search.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, how about this? Amir overhears a terrorist plot. He installs cameras to gather evidence, only they found out and they killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That means that a passenger was involved. A regular passenger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. And they mentioned the storage facility, which is where he got the C4121652.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But why would a passenger talk about the storage unit in front of Amir? Especially if they were gonna frame him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we're going about this all wrong. You are right. A--a passenger wouldn't openly discuss a--a terrorist plot, but a driver might. In the car. To a collaborator. Alone on the phone. What if Amir suspected another driver? Okay, here is Kevin McCann's last shift. This is the day before the murder. And look at that. He stopped near the storage facility where they kept the Cobalt 60.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He's a cab driver, Castle. He was probably dropping off a fare. Besides, he alibied out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There he is near the warehouse, too. That's 100 yards from where we found Amir's body. So, the last two places Amir was, and Kevin McCann has been to both of them? There's no way that that's a coincidence. We at least have to go see why this warehouse area is so popular.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Montgomery.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Okay. Got it. We got a location on the truck.

utterance.speaker: SENIOR OFFICER
utterance.content: One of my guys on the grid search spotted it!

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: The radiation detector go off?

utterance.speaker: SENIOR OFFICER
utterance.content: You bet!

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: How long has it been sitting here?

utterance.speaker: SENIOR OFFICER
utterance.content: Not long! The hood's still warm!

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Open her up!

utterance.speaker: AGENT MARK FALLON
utterance.content: Check all the buildings! Sweep every inch in a four block radius!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks empty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is where Kevin McCann parked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. Door. We gotta move. Ready? Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's Jamal.
